title: Co-Founder - Social Media & Content Creation
description:
About Chamberly AB
 





 Founded in 2023, Chamberly AB is a fast-growing Swedish startup on a mission to make mental well-being more accessible and supportive through technology. Our mobile app which is available on iOS and coming soon to Android, offers a safe, anonymous space for mental support. With over 100K downloads and an outstanding 4.8/5 rating globally, we’re proud to be making a meaningful impact. Join us in shaping the future of mental health support.
 




  






 We sometimes call Chamberly the tinder of mental health due to its highly interactive UI that connects listeners with users that want to vent about certain topics. Chamberly isn’t just a mental health platform, it’s a place to find your permanent emotional well-being partner that shares the same interest and life experiences as you, allowing users to wander off with their new found caring and relating best friend.
 




  






 We are young founders that leverage the latest AI technologies to build powerful features that make Chamberly a safe, highly-effective and fun place to be in.
 




  






 Please note:
 

 This is an unpaid position during the partnership trial. If you're a great fit, you’ll transition into a partner/co-founder role with equity and future compensation.
 




  






 Responsibility
 




*Social Media Strategy & Content Creation* 





 Take the lead on managing Chamberly’s presence on LinkedIn, Instagram, Tiktok, (and beyond!). You'll create thoughtful, engaging content and develop a clear strategy to grow our visibility, drive meaningful engagement, and build a strong online community around mental health.
 




  





*Event Planning & Community Engagement* 





 Plan and organize interactive events, both in-app (to keep our users inspired and engaged) and within the team (think about fun meetups, bonding activities, and team-building moments). You’ll be both the planner and the motivator who helps bring people together with purpose and joy.
 




  





*Culture Shaping* 





 Establish a culture of safety, kindness, creativity, and collaboration, for both our users and our team. You’ll help define and nurture the spirit of Chamberly, making sure it’s a place where people feel seen, supported, and empowered to grow.
 




  






 Your Experience (Required):
 



* Experience in creating content on multiple platforms and growing a followers base.
* Experience leading communities on Instagram, Tiktok, LinkedIn, or similar platforms.
* Are an active and curious user on various social media platforms, with a strong understanding of how different platforms work and what makes content truly connect with people.
* Have hands-on experience creating engaging content, and are comfortable using tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Express, Figma or similar for image and video editing.
* Bring a vibrant personality to the table: You're outgoing, empathetic, charismatic, and full of positive energy that uplifts both users and teammates.
* Communicate fluently in English (our working language), both in writing and speaking.



  






 Bonus Experience (Nice to have):
 



* Experience or passion for mental health, wellness, or emotional well-being
* Have the ability to lead, motivate, and mentor teams.
* Active involvement in community-driven causes (e.g., mental health advocacy, LGBTQ+ support, sustainability, animal welfare)
* A neutral public profile when it comes to political or geopolitical topics.
* Experience collaborating across cultures or remote, international teams.
* An international background with ability to communicate fluently in Swedish, both in writing and speaking.



  






 Flexibility & Freedom
 



* Choose your own working hours
* Hybrid: Mostly remote
* Easily fits alongside studies or other commitments



  






 Note:
 





 Even if you’re a half baked red velvet and don’t fulfill all the above, we may still find you super interesting!
 




  






 At Chamberly, we’re committed to creating an inclusive and respectful workplace. Your gender, ethnicity, religion, or any other personal trait will never affect your opportunity with us.
 




  






 Know someone perfect for this?
 





 Feel free to share this opportunity with them!
 




  






 Interested?
 





 Apply by submitting the form 😍

title: AI Product Manager
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**VNTRS is growing – Join us as an AI Product Manager!**
 We are now looking for a
 **Product Manager with deep interest in AI, start-ups, and entrepreneurial companies** 
 . Do you want to be part of our ambition to help startups succeed and expand our AI capabilities both within Sweden and internationally? Do you have strong product management skills and hands-on experience with AI technologies such as
 **LLMs, APIs, and prompt/vibe coding** 
 ? Do you want to work closely with startups to explore, build, and launch AI-driven products? Then you’ll love working with us at VNTRS!
   

  

**About VNTRS**
 Creating successful companies together with our clients is at the heart and soul of VNTRS. Too many great ideas fall short for the wrong reasons – we exist to change that. We don’t just consult – we partner up, sharing risks and upside alongside our co-workers and clients. We are currently 30 co-workers, with a fast-growing AI division. At VNTRS, you’ll work at the intersection of entrepreneurship, product management, and applied AI – helping founders and teams go from
 **AI hype to real, working products.**
**About The Job**
 As
 **AI Product Manager** 
 , you’ll play a leading role in shaping and delivering AI-powered solutions. You will:
   

  

* Translate cutting-edge AI/ML concepts into tangible products that solve real customer problems
* Explore and validate AI opportunities in early-stage startups and corporate ventures
* Drive product roadmaps that leverage large language models (LLMs), APIs, and custom integrations
* Collaborate with engineers, designers, and growth leads to ship AI-enabled features and MVPs quickly
* Experiment with prompt engineering, vibe coding, and lightweight prototyping to accelerate learning
* Guide clients on best practices for deploying and scaling AI systems responsibly


**What You’ll Do**
* Lead cross-functional AI teams (developers, ML engineers, UX, strategy)
* Build AI-powered products from concept to launch, balancing speed and quality
* Identify opportunities where AI can automate, personalize, or create new value streams
* Work hands-on with LLMs, open-source models, APIs, and no/low-code tools to design experiments
* Ensure ethical, user-centric, and data-driven product decisions
* Communicate insights and progress clearly to clients, founders, and teams


**Must-have Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, computer science, or equivalent
* 3–5 years of Product Management experience leading cross-functional teams
* Proven track record of taking digital products from idea to launch
* Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, especially LLMs and API-driven products
* Hands-on experience with prototyping (e.g., prompt engineering, vibe coding, or AI hackathons)
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
* Structured mindset, with ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Nice-to-have Requirements**
* Practical experience building with OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, or similar ecosystems
* Familiarity with vector databases, RAG pipelines, or fine-tuning models
* Startup or founder experience, ideally in AI-first products
* Experience as a consultant or managing external client projects
* Industry knowledge in fintech, healthtech, proptech, or other data-heavy sectors


 At VNTRS, this isn’t just about managing roadmaps – it’s about building the
 **next generation of AI-powered companies** 
 . If you’re excited to combine
 **product leadership with hands-on AI exploration** 
 , we’d love to talk to you!
   

  

 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 To succeed in our mission to create a great product experience, we are building a world-class Product Design Team — that can lead us into the unknown future of the Mentimeter product, fuelled by our desire to challenge tomorrow’s presentation and meeting experiences. We already have a great team in place, and we want to continue to learn and evolve as we grow.
   

  

**Senior Product Designer - Two Open Positions**
 Joining as a
 **Senior Product Designer** 
 means applying your broad design skill set in a cross-functional product team—collaborating closely with Product, Engineering, User Research, Data and other roles across the company. You’ll help shape the user experience in your part of the product, contribute to key product decisions, and raise the bar on design execution.
   

  

 The role includes helping your team discover and build great user experiences, contributing to shared design practices, and being a thoughtful partner across disciplines. You’ll be involved in both improving and iterating on existing experiences, as well as exploring new opportunities and long-term directions for the product. The work is hands-on and varied, combining interface design, systems thinking, working with hypotheses and a strong user perspective. We are looking for someone who is passionate about bringing true value to our users, collaborates well with others and ensures the work they do is at the highest level of craft and execution.
   

  

 We believe in the power of the empowered product team. Our organization is built to enable high alignment, outcome focus, and strong support from leadership—so that you and your team can do great work. Both of these roles are based in our Stockholm office, and you’ll have the ability to work from home or remotely two days per week.
   

  

 We’re hiring for
 **two roles:** 
 one in our
 **Commercial area** 
 , and one in our
 **Core** 
**area**
* Senior Product Designer in the Commercial area


 In the Commercial area, you’ll work on growth-focused initiatives that help users discover and adopt the value in Mentimeter—guiding them from free to paid, and from individuals to teams. This includes onboarding, activation, habit formation, monetization, fueling network effects and making it easier for teams to adopt Mentimeter across their organization.
   

  

 Your work will support both product-led growth and our Enterprise offering, helping ensure our customers succeed and scale with us. You’ll work hypothesis-driven and design flows like sign-up, onboarding, upgrades, team invites, and feature education—always balancing user experience with business goals.
   

  

 This is a great fit if you have experience in
 **B2B SaaS** 
 ,
 **product-led growth** 
**and experimentation** 
 ..
   

  

* Senior Product Designer in the Core area


 In the Core area, you’ll work on some of the most central parts of the Mentimeter experience—the interactive tools used by millions in live presentations. This includes designing intuitive and scalable solutions for data visualization, audience interactions, and new AI-powered features that enhance content creation and engagement.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with a cross-functional team to improve existing features and explore new directions for the user experience.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone with experience designing
 **consumer-facing apps** 
 , particularly those involving
 **data visualization** 
 ,
 **interactive experiences** 
 , or
 **AI-driven functionality** 
 .
   

  

 We are seeking a designer who demonstrates exceptional
 **craftsmanship** 
 and a deep understanding of
 **state-of-the-art** 
 design best practices. You are passionate about creating visually stunning and highly functional interfaces, with meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to delivering world-class design solutions. Your work will set a new standard for intuitive and engaging user experiences at Mentimeter.
   

  

**So, who are you?**
* Have 5+ years of experience in a Product Designer role
* Are deeply familiar with working in cross-functional product teams
* Have proven seniority in the product design craft and product thinking
* Collaborate effectively with Product and Engineering
* Use insights and research to inform your design decisions
* Communicate clearly through presentations, prototypes, and design specs
* Take ownership and help drive clarity and alignment within your team
* Appreciate diverse perspectives and thrive in an inclusive, people-first culture


**Not Required**
* You don’t have to know Swedish (daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 50 nationalities!)


 At Mentimeter, design is part of every step — from early exploration to shipping and learning. We believe in shared ownership, empowered teams, and space to grow our craft together.
   

  

**Join us in shaping the future of meetings. We'd love to hear from you!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

*Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an
 **onsite** 
 role with the possibility to work from home up to twice per week.*
*Learn more here about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.*
**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Senior Product Designer | EMEA/LATAM
description:
**Who We Are Is What We Do.**
 Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.
   

  

 Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.
   

  

**Why should you be part of our success story?**
 As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.
   

  

 Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.
   

  

 Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.
   

  

**Duties**
* Deeply analyse customers and business problems to identify the pain points
* Rapidly create impactful and elegant solutions to problems.
* Strategically think of the product from high level to connect the missing dots
* Present your design work and articulate your design decisions
* Update the acceptance criteria and define the logic to your work
* Take full cycle ownership of your work from ideation, design, review and feedback in the final test build and after release.
* Work closely with highly talented Product Managers, Product Designers and Developers
* Work holistically across multiple platforms to solve problems - The employee portal, the employer portal, and the admin dashboard for customer support.
* Build and update components in the Design system
* Above all - Be part of the journey to redefine a way of working for people all round the world


**Requirements**
* Be passionate about design
* Able to learn fast
* Experienced working in fast pace environment
* Experienced in end to end product design for web and app for at least 5 years
* Strong B2B experience
* Have strong knowledge and practice in both UX and UI
* Experienced in design systems
* Know when to go deep on a task and when to execute
* Be comfortable being embedded into a development team with light touch from the product manager. We believe that the work comes from everyone, not just top down.
* Be comfortable with being involved with the end to end development process. From ideation to design QA - you feed and unblock the team.
* For this role, you will need to be in EMEA or LATAM time zone


**Nice to have**
* Higher education in related fields


**Total Rewards**
 Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.
   

  

**Some things you’ll enjoy**
* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access


 At Deel, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that values diversity and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of race, religion, sex, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, pregnancy or maternity or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
   

  

*Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @* 
*deel.com* 
*and other acquired company emails like @* 
*payspace.com* 
*and @* 
*paygroup.com* 
*. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visiting* 
*our careers page* 
*.
   

  

 Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.
   

  

 Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.*
 We use Covey as part of our hiring and/or promotional processes. As part of the evaluation process, we provide Covey with job requirements and candidate-submitted applications. Certain features of the platform may qualify it as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under applicable regulations. For positions in New York City, our use of Covey complies with NYC Local Law 144.
   

  

 We began using Covey Scout for Inbound on March 30, 2025.
   

  

 For more information about our data protection practices, please visit our Privacy Policy. You can review the independent bias audit report covering our use of Covey here: https://getcovey.com/nyc-local-law-144

title: UX Lead – Ramudden Global
job_function: Design, Information Technology, and Product Management
description:
**About Ramudden Global**
 Ramudden Global is the global leader of temporary traffic management (TTM) solutions for critical infrastructure, combining rental of TTM safety equipment, digital solutions, and services.
   

  

 With over 5,000 employees across 13 countries and annual sales of €1 billion, our mission is clear:
 *to get people home safely every day* 
 . Whether it’s our employees, our customers, or the general public, safety always comes first.
   

  

 Our entrepreneurial spirit drives innovation, collaboration, and sustainable growth. We believe in shaping safer environments worldwide—through technology, creativity, and teamwork.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a
 **UX Lead** 
 to join Ramudden Digital and take a central role in shaping the experience of our digital platforms.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role where you will design services and experiences that turn complex systems into clear, human-centred solutions. Working closely with product managers, engineers, and operations, you will bring research, prototyping, and service design methods directly into product development—helping us create safer, smarter, and more efficient traffic management.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As UX Lead, you will:
   

  

* Work directly on design challenges—researching, mapping journeys, prototyping, and testing.
* Lead service design and UX activities on projects, from early discovery to shipped solutions.
* Create service blueprints, prototypes, and user flows that guide product direction.
* Facilitate workshops and co-creation sessions with colleagues, partners, and users.
* Share your expertise with colleagues and help raise the design craft within the team.


**What We’re Looking For**
 We’re seeking a
 **practical, hands-on designer** 
 who enjoys solving problems together with others. You’ll be a great fit if you have:
   

  

* A portfolio showing strong work in research, journey mapping, prototyping, and service blueprinting.
* Service design as your main strength, but confidence supporting UX/UI tasks when needed.
* Experience working closely with product managers and engineers to deliver real solutions.
* The ability to connect design insights to business needs without losing sight of users.
* 5+ years of experience in service or UX design.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.


**Work location:** 
 Our central Stockholm office, with flexibility to work from home when needed. Occasional travel is required, primarily within the Nordics, Germany, Belgium, North America and the UK.
   

  

**It’s a Plus If You:**
* Have experience with IoT or device management systems.
* Have worked with cloud-based platforms or digital ecosystems.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Ramudden, we work every day to ensure safe working environments. Joining us means contributing to a global mission:
 *ensuring everyone gets home safely, every day.*
 As part of our recruitment process, alcohol and drug testing, are conducted.
   

  

 For questions about the role, please contact:
   

  

**Pontus Raak** 
 – pontus.raak@ramuddendigital.com

title: Product Engineer
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**VNTRS is growing!**
 We are now looking for a Product Engineer with hands-on technical expertise who is passionate about start-ups and entrepreneurial companies. Do you want to combine your technical skills with product development, while playing a key role in shaping the products of tomorrow and helping enterprise companies evolve? Then this role might be for you!
   

  

**About VNTRS**
 At VNTRS, our mission is simple: turning great ideas into successful companies. Too many strong concepts fail for the wrong reasons and we exist to change that.
   

  

 We're a team of over 30 coworkers, all with skin in the game, which means we're all invested in the outcome and share the rewards. Partnering with promising entrepreneurs and corporations and giving our co-workers a stake in that success is at the core of what VNTRS is all about.
   

  

 We’re not just consultants. We become true partners, working side by side with our clients as one team to build, launch, and scale.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role you will get the best of two worlds. You’ll be both hands-on technical (software development) and strategic (product ownership). You will work closely with founders, designers, engineers, and growth leads to bring ideas to life from concept to launch.
   

  

 On some projects, you’ll focus on coding and technical architecture, on others you’ll drive product discovery, define roadmaps and guide teams toward the right priorities. No matter the setup, you’ll always have an impact on both what we build and how we build it - all the way from start-ups to enterprises.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Take ownership of both the technical implementation and the product vision in early-stage startups.
* Work with enterprise clients on both technical and product led assignments.
* Write code, review solutions and ensure technical quality.
* Participate in workshops with clients to define needs, scope and next steps.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (design, growth, strategy, investment) to shape successful products.
* Act as the bridge between business goals and technical execution.
* Help startups avoid pitfalls and coach them toward sustainable growth.


**Must-have Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in web development, preferably fullstack (JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React.js or similar).
* Experience in product ownership, product management or similar responsibilities.
* Developed or managed ML / AI native products.
* Ability to lead or guide teams and stakeholders.
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Hands-on start-up or consulting experience.


**Nice-to-have Requirements**
 Experience as a founder or early employee in a startup, including involvement in e.g. fundraising
   

  

**Why VNTRS?**
 Ownership in our investment fund with tech startups: All employees invest monthly in our exclusive portfolio.
   

  

 Challenging responsibilities: Real ownership from day one with support from senior colleagues.
   

  

 Great work-life balance: Social lunches, afterworks, and two yearly conferences.
   

  

 Generous benefits: Wellness grant, educational bonus, parental leave top-up and more.
   

  

*Does this sound like you? Apply now and help us build the products of tomorrow!*
 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Senior Product Manager - EOR
description:
**Who We Are Is What We Do.**
 Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.
   

  

 Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.
   

  

**Why should you be part of our success story?**
 As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.
   

  

 Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.
   

  

 Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.
   

  

**Summary**
 As a Senior Product Manager, you will own and influence the product strategy, roadmap and GTM for two strategically important areas:
 **EOR Growth** 
 (driving product-led growth to increase customer adoption) and
 **Managed HR** 
 (a tech-enabled HR advisory service).
   

  

 You’ll collaborate with senior leaders, designers, engineers and subject-matter experts across the organization to ensure the fast delivery of a best-in-class experience to a global customer base — while shaping how we gather customer insight, validate opportunities, and scale tech-plus-service products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Building a clear vision, strategy, and execution path for EOR Growth and Managed HR, aligning product positioning with delivery capabilities.
* Designing and executing product-led growth experiments that remove friction, optimise user journeys, and deliver measurable adoption and retention gains with clear attribution.
* Establishing structured customer feedback loops (e.g., advisory boards, representative panels) to replace anecdotal input with broad, data-driven insight.
* Working cross-functionally to collect and address the diverse needs of different product lines, especially where operational delivery intersects with the product experience.
* Leveraging all of the core PM skills you have honed to date to drive progress through the entire product development lifecycle — from rapid hypothesis testing to market launch.
* Collaborating with a team of highly talented product designers, engineers and product experts to execute your vision and deliver exceptional results at Deel speed.
* Balancing core product development with high-priority client escalations in a high-speed, remote-first working environment.
* Driving improvements to UX in regulated, compliance-sensitive environments, working closely with subject-matter experts to ensure solutions meet both customer needs and operational realities.


**What we’re looking for:**
* Minimum 5 years of product management experience in a fast-paced environment (ideally scale-up/start-up).
* Proven experience in product-led growth — designing and running experiments that demonstrably improved product adoption.
* Experience with tech-enabled services, where operational processes are a core part of the product experience.
* Independent and autonomous leader, comfortable making decisions quickly with incomplete information.
* Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills, especially in globally distributed teams.
* Understanding of both UX and UI, with a track record of removing friction points to drive growth.


**Why this role is exciting**
 You’ll directly influence how Deel scales two of its most important product areas, working on challenges that span product strategy, service design, and customer growth. You’ll have the scope to test and iterate quickly, introduce new customer insight practices, and shape how tech-plus-service products are built and delivered at a global scale.
   

  

 If you thrive in fast-moving environments, enjoy solving complex problems, and want to make an immediate impact in a product-focused company, this is your opportunity.
   

  

**Total Rewards**
 Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.
   

  

**Some things you’ll enjoy**
* Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and location
* Additional perks and benefits based on your employment status and country
* The flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

title: Konsult/Interim - UX Designer Lead sökes!
description:
**Konsult/interim UX Designer Lead sökes till regeringsuppdrag i Stockholm– var med och designa nationell e-tjänst!**
 Vill du bidra till samhällsnytta och samtidigt arbeta med UX på hög nivå? Nu söker vi dig som vill leda arbetet med att ta fram en nationell e-tjänst som ska förenkla för företag att anmäla miljöfarlig verksamhet – och samtidigt effektivisera kommunernas handläggning. Här får du möjlighet att påverka något viktigt, samarbeta med experter och se ditt arbete komma till nytta i hela landet. Uppdraget påbörjas snarast och sträcker sig till 2026-01-30 med ev. möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Bli en del av ett viktigt regeringsuppdrag med stort genomslag
* Arbeta i en tvärfunktionell grupp med hög kompetens
* Påverka framtida digitala lösningar för företag och kommuner
* Uppdrag med tydligt mål och konkret leverans
* Flexibelt arbete med möjlighet till delvis distansarbete


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Tar fram flöden, logiska samband och prototyper i Figma
* Skapar användargränssnittsspecifikationer
* Leder och samordnar UX-arbetet i projektet
* Testar prototyper tillsammans med företagare och kommuner
* Samarbetar med experter och kommunernas systemleverantörer
* Säkerställer genomförbarhet av lösningsförslagen


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du arbetar i ett projekt med tydligt uppdrag från regeringen, där målet är att ta fram ett enhetligt underlag för en nationell e-tjänst. Du blir en del av en arbetsgrupp bestående av experter inom miljö, juridik och digitalisering. Placering är i Stockholm, men det finns möjlighet till visst distansarbete. Uppdraget omfattar ej utveckling utan fokuserar på att ta fram material och specifikationer för kommunernas leverantörer.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har lång och dokumenterad erfarenhet inom UX – gärna mer än 10 år – och som självständigt kan driva arbete och leveranser. Du är trygg i hela processen: från behovsanalys och användarresor till färdig prototyp och dokumentation. Du har erfarenhet från komplexa uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, gärna myndighet, och är van att kommunicera tydligt i både tal och skrift. Du arbetar strukturerat, tar ansvar för helheten och har lätt för att samarbeta med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter. Två dagar i veckan (tirsdag och torsdag) behöver du kunna jobba på plats på kontoret i Hammarby sjöstad.
   

  

 Vi söker konsulter som är tillgängliga i närtid, men vi ser också att vi kommer ha behov framåt så hör gärna av dig eller gör en ansökan om du också kommer va tillgänglig längre fram. Vi har dig gärna i vårt nätverk för framtida uppdrag!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Projektledare/Digital Produktägare i Stockholm
description:
**Just nu söker vi konsulter till hösten 2025. Vi är öppna för dialog om tidigare anställning givet att vi gemensamt kan säkra ett uppdrag tidigare.**
**Om oss**
 B3 Business Transformation är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom digitalisering och förändringsarbete. Vi brinner för att skapa värde för våra kunder genom att leda komplexa projekt och utveckla nya arbetssätt. Vi fortsätter att växa och söker nu erfarna konsulter till vårt team med projektledare och strateger. Vill du utvecklas och inspireras i en miljö med erfarna, trevliga och prestigelösa kollegor i spännande uppdrag? Vi försöker leva som vi lär genom att kultur, utveckling och samarbete i teamet och bolaget med ett agilt och självorganiserande mindset som baseras på nyfikenhet, lust och utbyte av erfarenheter.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Som en del av vårt team får du tillgång till en dynamisk arbetsplats där din utveckling står i fokus. Vi erbjuder kompetensutveckling med tillgång till branschledande utbildningar och certifieringar. Du får möjlighet till spännande och varierande uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor. Vår arbetskultur präglas av öppenhet, samarbete och ambition att ligga i framkant. Du får också möjlighet att påverka och bidra till långsiktig förändring hos några av Sveriges mest intressanta organisationer.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som konsult hos oss kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa uppdrag hos välkända kunder.
   

  

 Som projektledare arbetar du med att stötta kunders förändringsarbete - från strategi hela vägen till ett förändrat beteende och nya eller förbättrade IT-stöd. Du arbetar ofta med ledningen hos våra kunder för att ta fram tydliga beslutsunderlag och roadmaps för genomförande och du coachar organisationen i införande av nya arbetssätt.
   

  

 Som digital produktägare kommer du arbeta med både mindre och större komplexa projekt eller agila strömmar hos välkända kunder. Du får ta ansvar för att leverera meningsfulla och hållbara digitala produkter utifrån agila arbetssätt, användarcentrering samt data- och AI-drivet. Det handlar främst om initiativ som syftar till att utveckla det digitala kundmötet och se till att processer och system finns på baksidan stödjer förflyttningen. Ofta ingår även i uppdragen att stötta kundens organisation och leda förändring mot att jobba effektivt och modernt med agila metoder för att hantera vision, roadmap, backlog etc, samt i olika utsträckning även hantera kommersiella och affärsutvecklingsfrågor.
   

  

 Utöver rollerna ovan tror vi du kan ta någon eller några av rollerna som programledare, kravanalytiker, scrum Master, verksamhetsutvecklare eller andra liknande roller.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi är erfarna konsulter med bred branscherfarenhet och har vana av förändringsarbete genom digitalisering. Vi söker dig som har liknande erfarenheter som konsult och minst 5 års erfarenhet av digitala förändringsprojekt och en stark förståelse för hur digitalisering kan stärka affären och möjliggöra nya arbetssätt. Du vill vara aktiv och delaktig i den fortsatta utvecklingen av B3 Business Transformation och kan proaktivt vara med och bygga våra egna nätverk som bidrar till nya affärer och relationer. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att arbeta såväl strategiskt, taktiskt som operativt.
   

  

 I rollen som Projektledare ser vi gärna att du:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för arbetet kring organisation, roller, arbetssätt, styrning och kultur i större digitaliserings- och IT-projekt
* Intar rådgivarrollen och är trygga med att såväl utmana som stötta så väl ledningspersoner och verksamhet, samt har god förståelse av vad konsultmässighet innebär
* Har erfarenhet av att driva projekt från strategi till förvaltning


 I rollen som Digital Produktägare ser vi gärna att du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att leda agila digitala projekt och/eller agila produktteam som exempelvis större webbprojekt, digital självservice, digital försäljning/growth eller implementering av CRM
* En god förståelse för det digitala kundmötet, affär, design/UX, teknik och moderna agila arbetssätt


**Det är toppen om du även har erfarenhet av**
* Någon eller några verksamheter inom medlemsorganisationer, kommunal verksamhet, offentlig sektor, logistik, retail, återvinning och hållbarhetsområdet eller försvar
* Har relevanta certifieringar inom områden som SAFe, Prosci Change Management och andra specifika områden
* Produkter eller sammanhang där traditionell och/eller generativ AI har varit en del

title: 3D Artist Intern
description:
**OPEN POSITION: 3D ARTIST INTERN — POLYGONAL MODELING & ASSET CREATION (Stockholm)** 




  
 



 We’re seeking a 3D Artist Intern focused on
 **polygonal/SubD modeling** 
 to join our digital team in Stockholm. You’ll work alongside industrial designers, UX/UI designers, and developers on projects for global companies and ambitious start-ups.
 



  
 



**Key Qualifications** 



* Strong passion for 3D modeling and a drive to refine your craft.
* Proficiency in
 **polygonal/SubD modeling** 
 (Blender, Cinema 4D, or similar).
* Solid grasp of
 **asset pipelines** 
 : structuring, naming conventions, optimization.
* Knowledge of
 **UV workflows** 
 and preparing meshes for texturing/animation.
* Experience with
 **Adobe Creative Suite** 
 (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro).
* Detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluent in English, spoken and written.



  
 



**Description** 




 As a 3D Artist Intern at Propeller, you will:
 


* Create high-quality polygonal assets for product design, animation, and interactive use.
* Interpret design intent and translate it into clean, production-ready meshes.
* Collaborate with designers and developers to ensure assets fit seamlessly into pipelines.



  
 



**Required Tools** 




 Applicants should be familiar with:
 


* **Blender** 
 or
 **Cinema 4D** 
 (polygon/SubD modeling)
* **Adobe Creative Suite** 
 (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro)
* **UV mapping** 
 and basic texturing workflows
* **Asset structuring** 
 and naming conventions for production pipelines



  
 



**Plus (nice to have):** 



* Rhino / SolidWorks (CAD/NURBS)
* Redshift, V-Ray, KeyShot (rendering)
* Unreal, Unity, Twinmotion (real-time)
* DaVinci Resolve
* Houdini



  
 



**Portfolio Requirement** 




 Please submit a portfolio or collection of previous work that clearly demonstrates:
 


* Polygonal/SubD modeling ability (wireframes, clean topology, optimized meshes)
* Asset preparation for animation, rendering, or real-time
* Attention to detail, form, and proportion



  





***Please note that only applications submitted to careers@propeller.se and accompanied by a portfolio will be considered.***




  
 



 This internship is paid.
 



  
 



 Does this sound like a position for you? Please send your application to
 **careers@propeller.se** 
 and make sure to state ”
 **3D Artist Intern** 
 ” in the subject field of the email.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 Games Design & Production
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to help us deliver an inspiring creative environment for our game teams. You will be responsible for the Content Creation Tooling area, which empowers teams and content creators with an adaptable tooling platform for creating content and experiences in our proprietary game engine, Fiction Factory.
   

  

 The Fiction Factory engine is made up of a highly-optimized runtime capable of high-quality 2D and 3D mobile gaming across a huge range of mobile devices, a content creation toolchain, and a content and build pipeline to enable King’s game teams to iterate quickly.
   

  

 As a Senior Product Manager in the Game Production organization, you will have an active role in defining our product strategy and building strong partnerships with our internal stakeholders and customers. You will also be responsible for understanding user problems and needs based on data and collaboration with our Users, UX and Engineering teams.
   

  

 This role belongs to part of the Kingdom we call Shared Tech. The teams within Shared Tech work as B2B organizations working across all the technology that we use to power our live games, including data infrastructure, machine learning, payments infrastructure and the game engines themselves. The vision within Shared Tech is "We are the stage where King games love to perform”.
   

  

**Your role within our Kingdom**
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with our major games and one of the largest game user bases in the world. You will be part of a product team responsible for end-to-end user experience, bringing impact to the business and end users, building new tools, technologies, and experiences, as well as improving existing ones.
   

  

**Your responsibilities will include;**
 Responsible for the product space for the Content Creation Tooling, which includes the framework for our content Editor and the platform for extending tooling capabilities.
   

  

 Effectively balance long-term technical innovation, user-facing improvements, strategic initiatives, and technical debt to deliver short- and long-term impact
   

  

 Build and maintain strong relationships with internal users, collaborators, and customers: capture needs, identify areas for collaboration, and communicate about strategies, plans, and releases
   

  

 Identify important opportunities in collaboration with Games, Product Managers, Engineering, and Product Design
   

  

 Drive product vision, strategies, and roadmaps in the context of broader organizational strategies and goals
   

  

 Incorporate data, research, and market analysis to inform product strategies and roadmaps
   

  

 Lead product discovery and development activities in partnership with Engineering and UX
   

  

 Support and motivate a team of engineers and other cross-functional representatives
   

  

 Coach and mentor junior product managers, and contribute to the overall product organization development
   

  

**Skills To Create Thrills**
 Proven experience working as a Product Manager in a cross-functional team
   

  

 Experience working in the game industry or on content creation tooling is good to have but not essential.
   

  

 Experience building and shipping applications or software features/products within a large-scale environment. Experience managing platform, API, or other foundational products is a plus.
   

  

 Due to the technical nature of the products, a technical background is preferable but not essential. Experience managing a product targeted at game developers is a plus.
   

  

 An outcome, impact, and continuous discovery mentality
   

  

 Strong communication skills: you can articulate both the vision and the details of product performance to teams and internal partners in both written and verbal form
   

  

 Experience creating buy-in, strong collaboration, and relationship building with engineers and stakeholders
   

  

 Experience integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution and evaluation
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Android Developer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer and Network Security, and Software Development
description:
**Title** 
 - Android Developer
 



**Location** 
 - Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





***This role is part of a security-classified project. Candidates will need to be eligible for background screening in line with national protective security regulations, and must have the right to live in Sweden.***




  





**About the Role -** 




  





 We’re looking for a skilled Android developer to join a team working on secure, encrypted mobile solutions for classified or privacy-critical environments. You'll be part of a collaborative unit delivering performance-critical apps that meet strict compliance and security requirements, offering the chance to contribute to something meaningful, with tangible, real-world impact.
 



  





**Required Skills -** 




  




* Kotlin for Android development
* Jetpack Compose for building modern UIs
* Gradle for build automation and configuration
* Dependency Injection (Dagger Hilt preferred)
* Coroutines for asynchronous programming
* Retrofit and OKHttp for network communication
* MVVM architecture and component-based design
* Unit testing using JUnit and Espresso
* Version control using Git
* Familiarity with MicroG is a bonus
* Any experience in UI/UX design is a plus



  





**About You -** 




  





 We’re seeking someone with a few years of experience across several of the following areas:
 



  




* A background in computer science, software development, or equivalent technical field.
* At least 3 years of experience as a native Android developer.
* Experience working on complex Android applications (e.g. with performance, security, or compliance considerations).
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work through technical challenges in a team setting.



  





 Join a highly specialised team developing secure, high-impact Android applications for mission-critical use across Europe. You'll work in a technically complex and security-focused environment, alongside experienced engineers building encrypted communication and information management tools.

title: Senior JavaScript Developer
description:
**Start date:** 
 Mid September 2025
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Full time, long term
   

  

**Location** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Senior Frontend Developer within JavaScript** 
 , to join our clients growing team. In this role, you’ll craft intuitive, responsive and secure interfaces that millions of customers worldwide rely on to shop and pay with ease.
   

  

 Your mission: bring checkout and payment flows to life with seamless design, world-class usability and rock-solid security. You’ll develop new features, refine the user journey and push the limits of performance to deliver experiences that feel effortless across devices.
   

  

 If you’re driven to create elegant solutions, elevate user experiences, and build trust through design and technology, this is the role for you.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and optimize interfaces for checkout and payment flows in e-commerce
* Ensure usability, performance, and accessibility across devices
* Implement security best practices in frontend applications
* Build and maintain modular solutions using design systems and component libraries
* Collaborate closely with backend developers, designers, and product owners in agile teams


**Job requirements**
 To succeed in this role, we see that you have:
   

  

* 10+ years of experience as a frontend developer
* Strong expertise in JavaScript and modern frameworks (React, preferably with TypeScript)
* Experience in developing checkout flows or other e-commerce payment solutions
* Solid understanding of frontend security principles
* Experience in responsive design and accessibility standards
* Experience working with design systems and modular components
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal language, with excellent communication and presentation skills


 It's not a must, but considered a plus if you have:
   

  

* Experience with TypeScript
* Knowledge of Node.js
* Experience in conversion optimization and customer journey improvements (A/B testing, UX enhancements)
* Experience in CI/CD pipeline and test automation
* Previous experience in international and agile environments


**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: AI Engineer med inriktning ledningsstödsystem
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld med fokus på utveckling av det civila försvaret. Vi stärker Sveriges förmåga att fungera i kris och till och med krig. Det betyder att alla våra medarbetare bidrar till beredskap och motståndskraft. Från norr till söder sprider vi kunskap och agerar för att skydda liv och hälsa, samhällets funktionalitet och grundläggande värden som demokrati, rättssäkerhet och mänskliga rättigheter. Den 1 januari byter vi namn till Myndigheten för civilt försvar .
   

  

 Vill du tillsammans med oss stärka samhället i att förebygga och hantera olyckor, kriser och konsekvenser av krig? Då kanske du är vår nästa kollega!
   

  

 Som AI-Engineer kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och produktionssättning av maskininlärningslösningar för de ledningsstödsystem myndigheten ansvarar för. Du kommer vara en del av teamet på enheten för tjänsteutveckling. Hos oss får du möjligheten att göra andra beredda att hantera kriser och krig.
   

  

**Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som AI Engineer kommer du att arbeta med hela kedjan – från design och utveckling av AI-baserade lösningar till drift och optimering i produktion. Beroende på behov kan det handla om att implementera NLP, LLM, generativ AI, computer vision eller reinforcement learning, liksom att bygga system för retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), chattbotar eller rekommendationslösningar. Du kommer att integrera AI-modeller i applikationer via API:er, finjustera färdiga modeller och optimera prestanda utifrån latens, kostnad och resursanvändning.
   

  

 En viktig del av arbetet är att sätta upp pipelines för datainsamling, preprocessing och deployment samt säkerställa att modellerna fungerar tillförlitligt i drift genom kontinuerlig monitorering (t.ex. kring bias, hallucinationer och data drift). Du kommer att samarbeta nära tjänsteägare, produktägare och UX-designers för att skapa AI-drivna användarupplevelser som är både värdeskapande och användarvänliga. Rollen innebär också ett ansvar för att säkerställa att lösningarna följer gällande etiska och regulatoriska ramar, inklusive GDPR, säkerhet och rättvis AI-användning.
   

  

**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av programmering i Python samt kunskap om maskininlärningsramverk som PyTorch och TensorFlow.
* Kunskap om datahantering i Python, ML-metodik, testning och versionshantering.
* Erfarenhet av API-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och använda pipelines för ML (Machine Learning).
* Kunskap inom DevOps.
* Kunskap inom databasteknik.
* Kunskap inom cloud services.
* Grundläggande kunskap inom webbutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av Quality Assurance för test och validering av lösningar.
* Grundläggande erfarenhet av CI/CD och MLOps.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom krisberedskap och civilt försvar.
* Erfarenhet från telekomsektorn.
* Arbetat med utveckling av AI-on prem lösningar.


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning.
   

  

 Din placeringsort kommer att vara Stockholm och resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Enheten för tjänsteutvecklings uppgift är innovation och utveckling av tjänster samt att
   

  

 kontinuerligt arbeta med att förbättra tjänster inom samhällsviktiga
   

  

 kommunikationstjänster.
   

  

 Vi har aktivitetsbaserat kontor där du kan välja arbetsplats efter egna behov. Du har också möjlighet att arbeta på distans. Vi erbjuder dig också en möjlighet att ta ut friskvårdstimme och du får även ett friskvårdsbidrag. För dig som statligt anställd finns också förmånliga semestervillkor.
   

  

 Alla vi som arbetar på MSB förväntas och ska bidra till ökad jämställdhet och likabehandling för en arbetsmiljö och ett samhälle fritt från diskriminering.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jon Gustafsson. Fackliga företrädare är Carl Önne (Saco-S), Jan Herremo (ST) och Ann-Britt Paradis eller Leif Fröhlen (SEKO). Samtliga nås via växelnumret 0771-240 240.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 12 september 2025.**
**Anställningsform** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Tillträde** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Löneform** 
 Månadslön
   

  

**Antal lediga befattningar** 
 1
   

  

**Sysselsättningsgrad** 
 100%
   

  

**Ort** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Län** 
 Stockholms län
   

  

**Land** 
 Sverige
   

  

**Referensnummer** 
 2025/207
   

  

**Publicerat** 
 2025-09-02
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag** 
 2025-09-12
   

  

**Dela länkar**

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our app team and are on the lookout for our a
 **Senior Android Engineer** 
 .
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As our Senior Android Engineer you will be working with our new, customer facing Android App. The app helps our customers to optimize their energy consumption, as well as contribute to a more sustainable world!
   

  

 You will be working closely with our Product Manager, Android Staff Engineer and the rest of the app team consisting of our designers and our engineers specialized in iOS, Android and Backend development. You will collaborate with the team to define and implement solutions from our roadmap. Discover more about the team by  listening to this interview.
   

  

**About The Android App**
* New app built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
* Interfaces with a newly built backend.
* Built using the latest and greatest frameworks from Google.
* Minimum version requirement is currently Android 10.


**Responsibility**
* Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend engineers to define application requirements and specifications.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following industry best practices and design patterns.
* Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and adherence to standards.
* Troubleshoot and resolve application issues, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest development trends, tools, and technologies, and evaluate their applicability to our projects.
* Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
* Contribute to documentation and provide insights on application architecture and design choices.


 Are We a Match?
   

  

 To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values  correlate with your own, since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward.
   

  

 We’ve been building cutting-edge features for our Android app since its launch in 2022, so to be a good fit you should bring deep Kotlin expertise and a strong passion for the Android development ecosystem.
   

  

 If you see yourself in the description above, we believe there’s great potential for a match. And if you also check off some (or all) of the boxes below, we think it could be an excellent fit!
   

  

* You know how to write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Kotlin and are willing to follow already defined coding guidelines and workflows.
* You have released at least one app on the Google Play store or have a project in the works that you can tell us about.
* You value team success over personal success.
* Our organizational language is English which is a must-have.


 The requirements may seem extensive, but please feel free to apply if you recognize yourself in some of them.
   

  

 What we offer?
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

**Application**
* We’ll start screening candidates during July, but interviews will begin in mid-August and early September.
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 We warmly welcome your application! ☀

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
Svea Solar is on the verge of transforming how we manage energy with just the click of a button. We're here to help our customers make the most of their energy usage while also balancing the energy grid with smart, innovative solutions. To bring this vision to life, we're expanding our app team and are on the lookout for our a
 **Senior Android Engineer** 
 .
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As our Senior Android Engineer you will be working with our new, customer facing Android App. The app helps our customers to optimize their energy consumption, as well as contribute to a more sustainable world!
   

  

 You will be working closely with our Product Manager, Android Staff Engineer and the rest of the app team consisting of our designers and our engineers specialized in iOS, Android and Backend development. You will collaborate with the team to define and implement solutions from our roadmap. Discover more about the team by  listening to this interview.
   

  

**About the Android app:**
* New app built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose.
* Interfaces with a newly built backend.
* Built using the latest and greatest frameworks from Google.
* Minimum version requirement is currently Android 10.


**Responsibility:**
* Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend engineers to define application requirements and specifications.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following industry best practices and design patterns.
* Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure code quality and adherence to standards.
* Troubleshoot and resolve application issues, ensuring high performance and responsiveness.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest development trends, tools, and technologies, and evaluate their applicability to our projects.
* Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.
* Contribute to documentation and provide insights on application architecture and design choices.


 Are We a Match?
   

  

 To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values  correlate with your own, since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward.
   

  

 We’ve been building cutting-edge features for our Android app since its launch in 2022, so to be a good fit you should bring deep Kotlin expertise and a strong passion for the Android development ecosystem.
   

  

 If you see yourself in the description above, we believe there’s great potential for a match. And if you also check off some (or all) of the boxes below, we think it could be an excellent fit!
   

  

* You know how to write readable, idiomatic, and maintainable Kotlin and are willing to follow already defined coding guidelines and workflows.
* You have released at least one app on the Google Play store or have a project in the works that you can tell us about.
* You value team success over personal success.
* Our organizational language is English which is a must-have.


 The requirements may seem extensive, but please feel free to apply if you recognize yourself in some of them.
   

  

 What we offer?
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

**Application**
* We’ll start screening candidates during July, but interviews will begin in mid-August and early September.
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.


 We warmly welcome your application! ☀

title: Anestesisjuksköterska till Anestesimottagningen i Falun på 50%
description:
Hos oss i Region Dalarna får du ett meningsfullt arbete där du kan göra skillnad. Tillsammans arbetar vi för ett hållbart Dalarna med utvecklingskraft i länets alla delar.


Op/An/IVA-kliniken i Falun innefattar Intensivvårds-avd, Anestesimottagning, Sterilteknisk avd, Centraloperations-avd och Dagkirurgi-avd med allmän kirurgi, kärl, urologi, ortopedi och gynekologi/obstetrik samt ögon- och öronoperationer. Dessutom bistår vi Ögon- och Öronoperation med anestesitjänst. Stor intensivvårdsverksamhet med 10 bemannade intensivvårdsplatser.


**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------



I arbetsuppgifterna för en anestesisjuksköterska på anestesimottagningen Falu Lasarett ingår:

* Preoperativa bedömningar
* Telefonrådgivning
* Sedera vid/lägga blockader
* Insättning av piccline
* Insättning av långtids-PVK
* Postoperativ uppföljning, EDA och PCA
* Uppföljning och bedömning av smärtkonsultationer
* Handhavande av smärtpumpar på avdelning, sc, iv och spinal
* Assistera vid insättning av tunnelerade spinalkatetrar
* Undervisning
* SCS (Spinal cord stimulation) programmering


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------



Krav:

* Du är specialistsjuksköterska inom anestesisjukvård och har tjänstgjort minst tre år inom specialiteten.


Meriterande:

* Du har tidigare erfarenhet av SCS (Spinal cord stimulation) programmering och utbildning inom smärta.


Viktigast är dock att du har ett stort intresse och engagemang för vår specialitet. Har en god samarbetsförmåga, förmågan att organisera, samordna och prioritera arbetsuppgifter. Du ska kunna hantera stressiga situationer och vara flexibel. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


**Ansökan**
-----------



H


Har du skyddade personuppgifter? Ansök **inte** via systemet. Kontakta istället rekryterande chef direkt.


Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@regiondalarna.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss.


Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region (Landstinget) Dalarna kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.


Läs mer om Region Dalarna, vår värdegrund, arbetsmiljö och förmåner, samt vilka kontroller som görs innan anställning: Jobba med oss - Region Dalarna

*Vi har gjort vårt medieval och vill därför ej bli kontaktade av andra säljbolag eller rekryteringsföretag.*


Detta arbete innebär direkt och regelbunden kontakt med barn och/eller ungdomar. Innan erbjudande om anställning kan ske, måste du som sökande uppvisa utdrag ur Polisens belastningsregister i obrutet kuvert alternativt via ett digitalt registerutdrag, enligt lag 2013:852 eller 2000:873. Mer information finns här: Belastningsregistret - begär utdrag (polisen.se).


  
**Om anställningen**
--------------------


**Befattning:** Sjuksköterska


**Ort:** Falun


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare


**Från och med:** Tillträde enligt överenskommelse


**Antal tjänster:** 1


**Omfattning:** 50%

 **senast:**  

2025-10-02

--------------------
