* Har erfarenhet av att skriva teknisk produktdokumentation, såsom System Software Quality Assurance Plan, V&V Plans, Configuration Management Plan (ej användarmanualer)
* Har erfarenhet av att skriva teknisk dokumentation som uppfyller EN-standarder
* Har insikter och erfarenhet av de olika EU-direktiv kopplat till dokumentationskrav
* Gillar att ha kontakt med många olika människor och är mycket bra på samarbete
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Är strukturerad och noggrann
* Har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
* Har en teknisk utbildning
* Är mycket bekväm i en agil miljö
* Har goda kunskaper i MS Office och JIRA


**Övrigt:**
* Starkt meriterande är insyn i EN-50657-standarden (Software on Board Rolling Stock), då man kommer jobba nära teamet för att ta fram dokumentation enligt den specifika standarden.
* Erfarenhet av easeRequirements, Zephyr samt JIRA Links Explorer Traceability & Hierarchy.
* Du har en teknisk bakgrund och goda kunskaper om mjukvaruutveckling. Kvalitén på dokumentationen kommer att utvärderas av en tredje, oberoende part och kommer vara avgörande för tågets godkännande.

title: Linux systemadministratör
description:
*Är du en erfaren Systemadministratör med djup kunskap inom Linux? Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och arbeta med avancerade IT-lösningar inom drift och infrastruktur?* 




 Vi söker en Linux Systemadministratör med några års erfarenhet som har passion för att skapa stabila och effektiva miljöer och som vill spela en nyckelroll inom IT-drift. Här får du arbeta med den senaste tekniken och bidra till att säkerställa högpresterande system och sömlös infrastruktur.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Linux Systemadministratör kommer du att spela en viktig roll i ett driftteam och samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa stabilitet och hög tillgänglighet i system. Du kommer att ha ansvar för att underhålla och optimera Linux-plattformar samt hantera olika aspekter av systemadministration och säkerhet. Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att upprätthålla en effektiv och säker IT-miljö, där du arbetar proaktivt för att identifiera och lösa eventuella tekniska utmaningar. Det är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och bidra till utvecklingen av en stabil och framtidssäkrad infrastruktur.
 



  





**Vi tror att du är en driven systemadministratör som har:** 



* **Flera års erfarenhet av Linux** 
 (exempelvis Red Hat, CentOS, Ubuntu) med en förståelse för systemets ekosystem
* **Drift och underhåll av Linux-servrar** 
 , inklusive säkerhetskonfigurationer och nätverksadministration
* **Kunskap inom automatisering och scripting** 
 , gärna erfarenhet med verktyg som Ansible, Puppet eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i
 **komplexa IT-miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet och säkerhet**
* Erfarenhet av
 **containerverktyg** 
 som Docker och Kubernetes för att hantera och skala applikationer
* Erfarenhet av
 **webbaserade och serverinriktade tjänster** 
 , till exempel Apache, Nginx och databassystem (SQL och noSQL)



  





**Meriterande erfarenhet** 



* Erfarenhet av
 **CI/CD-pipelines** 
 och automatisering av deploy-processer
* Kunskap om
 **säkerhetslösningar** 
 inom IT-infrastruktur och erfarenhet av avancerade säkerhetskonfigurationer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med
 **HPC (High-Performance Computing)** 
 och GPU/vGPU-hantering
* Erfarenhet av
 **Linux VDI** 
 -lösningar och hantering av virtualiserade Linux-miljöer



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du en stabil anställning med:
 


* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och fast månadslön
* Möjligheter att utvecklas och specialisera dig inom ditt expertområde
* En öppen och trivsam arbetskultur med regelbundna aktiviteter för teamkänsla och gemenskap



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är en ledande aktör inom drift och IT-infrastruktur och arbetar med marknadsledande företag inom en rad olika branscher. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas inom avancerade projekt och arbeta med den senaste tekniken. Vi är måna om att våra medarbetare trivs och erbjuder en trygg och utvecklande miljö där du får stöd i din karriärutveckling.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Låter detta som ditt nästa steg? Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Ready to reimagine the future of retail?** 




  





 At Bambuser, we’re transforming how the world shops online by bringing video commerce to life for some of the world’s most beloved brands. Our customers’ success is our passion, and we believe in the potential of every individual. Together, we’re building the future of retail, with data playing a central role in how we operate, grow, and make decisions.
 



 We offer an open, honest, and friendly workplace where every opinion matters. Conversations can get lively because we care deeply about what we build. But we always have each other’s backs and make space to enjoy the ride.
 



**Join Bambuser as a Data Engineer and help us take our data platform to the next level.** 
 From product analytics to business-critical insights, you’ll be working at the core of our data ecosystem. Your work will enable smarter decisions, faster development, and better collaboration across the company. If you’re passionate about building reliable pipelines, designing scalable architecture, and contributing to a curious, capable team, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do**



* **Build & Scale:** 
 Design, implement, and maintain our data platform on GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub), ensuring pipelines are reliable, efficient, and secure.
* **ELT Excellence:** 
 Create robust ELT workflows using Dataform/dbt, SQL, and Python to transform raw data into analytics-ready datasets.
* **Architectural Leadership:** 
 Lead discussions on data architecture, deployment automation, and CI/CD practices to streamline our data workflows and ensure maintainability.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Partner closely with analysts, developers, and product teams to capture requirements, shape data-driven features, and deliver actionable insights.
* **Observability & Quality:** 
 Implement monitoring, logging, and governance processes to ensure data reliability, accuracy, and documentation.



  





**Who you are**




 We believe you have:
 


* Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
* Hands-on experience with GCP data technology: BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub, or equivalent.
* A proven track record building and scaling data pipelines at production scale.
* Experience with ELT/ETL frameworks such as Dataform or dbt\_.
* Solid software engineering practices: version control (Git), automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Excellent communication skills; adept at working with cross-functional stakeholders.
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)



 We'd consider it a bonus if you have experience with:
 



 Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, streaming data architectures, client-side logging, or observability tools such as Prometheus and Grafana.
 



  





  





**Curiosity** 
 , clear
 **communication** 
 , and a
 **thoughtful** 
 approach to problem-solving go a long way in this role. We value people who ask good questions and enjoy learning as part of a team.
 



  





**Tools we use**




 GCP | BigQuery | Dataform | Dataflow | Airflow | Terraform | Python | Cube.dev | Steep | Embeddable
 



  





**Why join Bambuser?**




 We’re pioneers in live commerce, partnering with some of the world’s most loved brands to create engaging and innovative shopping experiences. As part of our growing team, you’ll help scale a platform that is changing how people shop online.
 



 At Bambuser, you’ll take ownership of meaningful projects, face new challenges, and contribute directly to the development of our product. The work you do will have real impact and be used by thousands of shoppers in real time.
 



 This role is based in Stockholm and offers a flexible work setup. You’ll have the freedom to focus from home when needed, while also spending time with your team in our beautiful office in the city center.
 



  





  





**This is Bambuser**




 Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.
 



*Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.*

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.
   

  

 Our CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) system is at the core of it all, and we’re looking for an experienced developer to help us develop it further!
   

  

**The role**
 As a Senior Software Developer, you’ll work in a cross-functional team focused on building and maintaining scalable features using Java, JavaScript, and cloud-native tools. You’ll collaborate with product managers and architects, solve real business problems with clean technical solutions, and help keep things stable, efficient, and well-documented along the way.
   

  

**What You'll Bring**
* 5+ years of experience in software development
* Solid Java skills and confidence in building scalable backend systems
* Comfortable working across the stack (JavaScript, TypeScript a plus)
* Experience with CI/CD and cloud tools like Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
* A practical approach to solving problems and delivering value
* Fluent in English


**Nice To Have**
* SaaS experience
* Familiarity with test automation
* DevOps mindset


**Recruitment Process**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview
* Interview with our CPO
* Reference check


**What We Offer**
* A solid and stable company with over 20 years of industry experience.
* Flexible hybrid setup - 3x week at the office
* 33 days of paid time off – 30 vacation days plus 3 extra to make sure you get the rest you deserve.
* Premium occupational pension – Our pension plan goes beyond ITP1, with higher employer contributions depending on your age and salary level.
* Generous wellness allowance – 5,000 SEK annually to support your health and wellbeing.
* Private healthcare insurance – Skip the waiting lines and get quick access to private medical care, including specialist consultations and treatments.
* Parental leave top-up – We top up your parental leave so you receive up to 90% of your base salary for up to 6 months, helping you focus on your family without financial stress
* Weekly treats – Fika one week, breakfast the next, because good food brings people together.


 This role is based in Stockholm, where we have invested in creating our unique home right next to Hötorget station.
   

  

 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Partnerships Sales Manager
company_industry: Climate Technology Product Manufacturing and Environmental Services
description:
*Are you looking for a place where ambition meets real impact? Do you have a proven track record of building strong partnerships? Are you ready to take your career to the next level in a fast-growing start-up? Continue your growth at Grale - an award-winning green tech company redefining sustainable materials.* 




  





*Now, we’re growing our team and looking for an exceptional* 
***Partnership Sales Manager***
*. At Grale, you’ll have the freedom and support to grow - with the opportunity to shape your role, develop new skills, and advance your career as we scale globally.* 




  





**Partnership Sales Manager** 




 Grale’s unique offering combines sustainability and brand visibility. Our partners use our eco-friendly products as marketplaces for their brands - placing their message where people live, move, and consume. As a Partnership Sales Manager, your role is to build and sell these opportunities, helping brands reduce their plastic footprint while amplifying their reach in meaningful, visible ways. As a Partnership Sales Manager you’ll be helping companies reduce their plastic footprint while amplifying their brand impact
 



  





 You will be responsible for creating, developing, and managing commercial partnerships that generate revenue, strengthen brand positioning, and deliver measurable business value for both Grale and our clients.
 



  





**Main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 



* Identify and engage potential partners and clients across key sectors.
* Building strong relationships with key decision-makers (often marketing managers, brand leads, HR or Employee engagement managers, agency representatives, event managers, franchises etc.)
* Design and pitch tailored offerings – Sell and package Grale’s partnership and brand placement opportunities, positioning our products as a marketplace for visibility and awareness.
* Negotiate and close deals and long-term strategic collaborations.
* Coordinate with internal teams (e.g. product, logistics, design) to ensure flawless execution.
* Stay ahead of trends in sustainable marketing, eco-innovations, brand activations and partnerships.



  





 This role has no limits - a partnership could include anything from office product transitions and employee engagement programs to brand activations, festivals, campaigns, and educational initiatives that inspire both employees and customers, turning sustainability goals into measurable action.
 



  





**What you bring:** 



* B2B sales experience preferably from media, events, partnerships, or brand activations.
* A proven track record of building high-value partnerships.
* Experience with CRM systems (we work with hubspot) and a structured, data-driven approach to pipeline management.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.



  





**We also see that you:** 



* Are results-driven and motivated by closing deals and building long-term customer relationships.
* Thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
* Are both strategic and operational, comfortable running the entire sales cycle yourself.
* Are a self-starter with a hands-on attitude: you like to take initiative and own your results.
* Are passionate about sustainability and want to help drive meaningful change.



  





**What you get:** 



* The chance to be part of a fast-growing startup making measurable environmental impact.
* Work alongside award-winning founders featured on
 **Forbes 30 under 30** 
 and awarded
 **Prince Daniel Fellowship.**
* Shape a global brand from the ground up.
* Beautiful, modern office in the heart of Stockholm.
* Free daily breakfast.
* Wellness grant + access to gym and health activities.
* Weekly after works and a collaborative, high-energy culture.
* Opportunities for professional and personal development.



  





*Imagine a world where our oceans are free from plastic and our planet thrives. At* 
***Grale***
*, we’re not just imagining it - we’re building it. Plastics are made from petroleum and stay in our environment for thousands of years. By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the sea. We’re here to change that - and we’re looking for passionate people to join us.* 




  





*🏆 Grale has been awarded as the* 
***World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup***
*- selected from 1,400 companies globally* 




  





*🥇 Awarded prestigious* 
***Global Tech Innovator***
*- chosen among 2,000 technology companies worldwide* 




  





**Interested?** 




 We are interviewing continuously with the aim of filling the position as soon as possible. Apply today to join a team shaping a sustainable future! 🌱

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Senior DevOps Engineer** 




**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (on-site, no remote)
 



**Contract:** 
 15 September 2025 - 15 March 2026
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join a high-performing engineering team and help design, automate, and deliver robust DevOps solutions across both on-premises and Google Cloud environments. This role will focus on infrastructure automation, secure cloud migrations, CI/CD optimisation, and operational excellence. You will need strong hands-on technical expertise, programming skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Design, implement, and manage Infrastructure as Code using Terraform and Ansible
* Architect secure, scalable, high-performance solutions using GCP native and managed services
* Lead migrations from on-premises to cloud, including automation and validation
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps preferred)
* Develop automation scripts (Python, Shell) and integrate APIs to reduce manual effort
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless delivery and operations
* Contribute to internal or open-source codebases and continuously improve DevOps practices
* Apply best practices in security, governance, and access management
* Present technical solutions clearly to stakeholders



  





**Technical Requirements** 



* Proven DevOps experience with strong Terraform and Ansible skills (public/private repos or project examples a plus)
* Advanced Python programming; proficiency with Shell, YAML, JSON, and HCL
* Experience with CI/CD automation and Git workflows (Azure DevOps preferred)
* Solid understanding of GCP services and cloud infrastructure design
* Familiarity with containerization and hypervisors (Linux, KVM a plus)
* Experience in Agile and CI/CD environments
* Understanding of IT security principles and practices
* Familiarity with Nautobot and plugin development is a plus



**Nice to Have** 



* Networking experience (BGP, routing, switching, firewalls)
* Experience with Juniper or Palo Alto devices
* Knowledge of Algosec, Squid Proxy, or migration tools such as M2VM
* Exposure to emerging agentic AI automation frameworks



  





**Soft Skills** 



* Strong communicator, able to explain complex solutions clearly
* Proactive and self-driven, able to take ownership of deliverables
* Analytical thinker and problem solver
* Collaborative and adaptable team player

title: Quantitative Analyst to Market Quants
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
*We are seeking a passionate Front Office Quantitative Analyst to join our Stockholm office. Join our Markets Quant Centre of Excellence and shape the future of quantitative analytics at Danske Bank!*
 The Markets Quant Centre of Excellence at Danske Bank is a highly motivated team working with applied mathematics in the financial industry. Our team is at the forefront of our field and has an international vibe with approximately 40 employees from various nationalities working out of Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Vilnius.
   

  

**About Us**
 The Quant Centre of Excellence is part of the Markets Cluster development organization. Located on the trading floor, we are responsible for the full stack of development, from problem formulation and equation solving to numerical implementation of solutions for pricing, quoting, and risk management applications.
   

  

 Quants at Danske provide top-quality industry-level analytics, unified across asset classes using our award-winning pricing and risk management library, SuperFly. Our analytics and solutions support efficient Fixed-income, Foreign Exchange, and Equity Derivatives trading and are used in various businesses and purposes, such as XVA, Loans, Treasury, Market Risk, Regulatory, and settlements.
   

  

 Qualified candidates will join a motivated team at a time when the bank is scaling its platform and expanding our market-leading trading franchise and quantitative setup. We believe the coming years will be exciting and rewarding, offering a wealth of possibilities and experience.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This position offers a rare opportunity to join our Stockholm office. You will sit on the trading floor and engage daily with Sweden’s leading Fixed Income and/or Equity Derivatives trading division office. You will be one of two to three Quants on site and will work closely with the rest of the Quant and IT teams, mainly located in Copenhagen. Supported by leading industry analytics, you will develop solutions and workflows for pricing and risk management.
   

  

**What Are We Looking For?**
 We seek open-minded and committed candidates with a collaborative spirit and strong work ethic. You possess strong skills in combining Mathematics, Finance, and Programming and are comfortable with:
   

  

* Probability theory, stochastic analysis, and partial differential equations, with an intuitive approach to mathematical analysis and modelling
* Financial markets modelling, ideally with experience in derivatives pricing
* Programming in Python and C++ or C#


 You enjoy practical problem-solving, numerical implementation, and application building. Typically, this is demonstrated through an MSc or PhD in a relevant subject.
   

  

**Interested?**
 For further information, please reach out to Johan Hydén hyd@danskebank.dk, Head of FIC Quant Applications.
   

  

  

  

 We are going through applications on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate – apply for the position right away!
   

  

 Last day to apply is 23rd of September. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: QA/Test Lead för webbtjänster - OKQ8 Tech
description:
*Hela samhället ställer om mot en fossilfri framtid. Vi vill visa vägen i utvecklingen av vår bransch, så att fler kan ta sig fram, ta hand om sitt fordon och driva verksamheter med ett så lågt klimatavtryck som möjligt. Vill du vara med och bidra till hållbar utveckling, på riktigt? Välkommen att följa med på vår resa!*
 Som QA/Test lead blir du en del av digitaliseringen av OKQ8. Rollen är skandinavisk och täcker både Sverige och Danmark, med fokus på att skapa intuitiva och användarvänliga digitala produkter och tjänster för våra kunder. OKQ8:s IT- och digitala affärsavdelning genomgår just nu en omfattande transformation för att accelerera utvecklingstakten, höja kvaliteten på våra digitala tjänster och produkter samt öka effektiviteten för våra kunder. Du får här möjlighet att påverka framtidens digitala landskap inom en organisation med korta beslutsvägar och en inspirerande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I samarbete med produktägare, designers, utvecklingsteam och affären kommer du ansvara för att kvaliteten inom våra olika webbprojekt efterföljs. Ansvaret innefattar de öppna webbplatserna (okq8.se/q8.dk/f24.dk) samt våra kundportaler. Framför allt är det fokus på nyutveckling och de nya projekt som vi genomför nu under 2025/2026.
   

  

 Den avdelning du blir en del av har det övergripande strategiska och operativa ansvaret för:
   

  

* Att driva utvecklingen av OKQ8:s webbplattformar på den svenska och danska marknaden samt att driva innovation och digitalisering inom detta område.
* Att utveckla och förbättra digitala tjänster och produkter för våra externa kunder, både privatpersoner och företag.


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden inkluderar:**
* Synkronisera end-to-end tester med business-teamen
* Ansvara för det vi utvecklar håller den kvalitet vi eftersträvar
* Skapa test case inför releaser för webben
* Säkerställa acceptanskriterier i kravställningen
* Skapa buggar och jobba med teamet i DevOps


**Vi söker**
 Vi ser att du har tidigare erfarenhet inom QA och testning inom webbområdet.
   

  

 Du har en god teknisk förståelse för digitala plattformar och förståelse för kundupplevelser i en digital miljö. Du är nyfiken på nya digitala trender och hur de kan tillämpas för att skapa bättre lösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

**Vi ser att du har:**
* Minst tre års arbetslivserfarenhet inom området
* Trivs med att arbeta i team.
* Har en analytisk och strukturerad ådra.
* Är proaktiv och initiativrik.
* Har god kommunikativ förmåga och kan samarbeta på alla nivåer.
* Har ett intresse för att utveckla digitala produkter och processer.
* Flytande svenska (i tal och skrift) samt god professionell engelska


 Det är en meriterande om du har erfarenhet av några av följande delar med det viktiga är att du har tidigare erfarenhet av yrket:
   

  

* API Testning såsom Postman, SoapUI, ReadyAPI.
* Optimizely eller annat CMS
* Integrationer
* Google Tag manager
* Automatiserade tester
* Agila arbetsmetoder
* Arbetat som konsult


**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss på OKQ8 får du arbeta i en flexibel miljö med viktiga och varierande arbetsuppgifter. Vi uppmuntrar samarbete, innovation och utveckling – och vi tror på att vi tillsammans gör varandra bättre. Här blir du en del av en familjär kultur där vi stöttar varandra, har roligt tillsammans och där du ges möjlighet att växa och göra skillnad. Vi vill vara ett företag som speglar samhället, med en inkluderande kultur som minskar utanförskap och främjar mångfald.
   

  

*I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater.* 
*För den här tjänsten behöver du vara medborgare i ett EU/EES-land eller ha permanent uppehållstillstånd i Sverige.* 
**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 
 Om företaget
 **Ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb. På riktigt.**
 Vi vet att det är en vågad sak att säga, men vi menar verkligen varje ord. Oavsett om det handlar om ditt första jobb, ditt sista jobb, eller om du har modet att anta en ny utmaning, tror vi att du kan få ditt livs kanske viktigaste jobb här hos oss. På riktigt.

title: Communications & ESG Director - Verisure Nordics
description:
**Verisure is seeking an experienced and passionate Nordic Communications & ESG Director to join our Cluster Leadership team, reporting to the Nordics HR & Communications Director, with potential to grow into a direct report to the General Manager Nordics & Sweden.** 
 This role is pivotal for our growth, driving reputation, employee engagement, and business outcomes through strategic and impactful communications and ESG leadership.
 







**This is a rare opportunity to step into a high-growth, high-performing and profitable business with a clear mission: to protect what matters most. Verisure operates in a category with remarkably low market penetration, offering vast potential for expansion.** 
 Our growth is rapid, resilient, and highly profitable — powered by a recurring revenue model and deep, long-term customer relationships. What sets Verisure apart is the strength of our platform: a robust, scalable operating model and a high-performing culture rooted in purpose.
 







**This is a newly created, standalone role — reflecting the growing importance of Communications and ESG in our strategic agenda.** 
 As our organization continues to evolve, this role will play a critical part in shaping and building the function across the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to carry and expand what’s already in motion, while designing and driving new initiatives that support our future ambitions.
 







**We are seeking an exceptional corporate communications leader with a broad background spanning external  and internal communications, change and transformation, ESG, and stakeholder engagement.** 
 As Nordic Communications & ESG Director, you will impact on the communciations value chain — reputation, employee engagement, executive communications, ESG positioning and strategic messaging — delivering measurable impact across the organization. This newly created, high-visibility role is ideal for a top performer with a strategic mindset, strong project management skills, and hands-on experience. You will collaborate across multiple country teams and contribute to the broader Group Communications and ESG community, combining strategic insight with operational excellence to elevate our brand, culture, and business impact.
 







**We’re growing fast, we’re doing it right — and we’re still just getting started.** 








***Discover more on our website www.verisure.com and our I***
***nvestors Page***
***including our company presentation and annual report.***







**About Verisure**





**Verisure is the leading provider of professionally monitored security services with 24/7 response in Europe and Latin America.** 








 Every day, our dedicated teams use leading technology to Deter, Detect, Verify and Intervene to protect more than 5.7 million families and small businesses from intruders, fire, and health emergencies across 17 countries.
 



 With over 35 years of insights, experience and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity.
 







 Our mission is to give our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them. We believe that everyone has the right to feel safe and secure.
 







 Thanks to a strong focus on high quality service, we aim to have the most satisfied and loyal portfolio of customers in the industry. We estimate that we have some of the strongest growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services, which demonstrates our commitment to exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.
 







*For more information:* 
***www.verisure.com***
  
 










**Verisure in the Nordics**





**Verisure was founded in Sweden more than 35 years ago, we then quickly expanded across the Nordic geographies, this broader cluster represents important markets for Verisure, with an ambition to continue growing and expanding, delighting customers and shaping the monitored security category across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland.**

 Sweden is the third largest market for Verisure, and Norway the fifth. Denmark and Finland play strategic roles in our portfolio. All of these markets have seen very strong growth over the last five years, and are #1 in their addressable market. Today we are proud to serve our customers with over 2000 committed colleagues across the footprint.
 








**Strengthening our image and reputation with a variety of stakeholders, and positioning Verisure as a trustworthy leading company is key to making the Nordics markets the most recognized and most preferred provider for home and small businesses security solutions.**











**The role of Communications & ESG Director – Verisure Nordics**





 The Communications Director is a newly created, high-impact role leading the function across the Nordics. Reporting to either the Nordic HR & Communications Director or the General Manager Nordics, you’ll collaborate closely with Management Teams, Communications Leaders, and Marketing Directors across four countries.
 







**This is a newly created, standalone role — reflecting the growing importance of Communications and ESG in our strategic agenda.** 
 As our organization continues to evolve, this role will play a critical part in shaping and building the function across the Nordics. You will have the opportunity to carry and expand what’s already in motion, while designing and driving new initiatives that support our future ambitions.
 







**Joining during a dynamic phase of growth and transformation, you’ll shape and execute the Nordics’ external and internal communications strategy, lead implementation across markets, and build capabilities that elevate brand presence and business impact.** 
 With significant autonomy, you'll tailor communications plans per market, working hand-in-hand with country leadership and business teams. As a trusted advisor, you'll provide strategic guidance and hands-on execution across reputation, media, and employee engagement—ensuring alignment between internal and external messaging. You'll also collaborate with Group-level teams, contributing to international communications strategies and projects.
 







**This is a rare opportunity to build the function from the ground up in a fast-growing B2C company. You'll work directly with senior leadership, influence business-critical messaging, and shape public perception—while advancing your career in a high-growth, high-impact environment.** 








 Main responsibilities and impact
 

**Strategic leadership in Corporate Communications**



* Lead, develop, and implement the internal and external communications strategy for the Nordic Cluster in support of our ambitious business goals.
* Design and deliver integrated communications campaigns that drive business growth.
* Develop and execute an internal communications program that fosters pride, alignment, and engagement across teams.
* Collaborate with Group Communications to localize global narratives and amplify their impact.
* Oversee media relations, including proactive storytelling and responsive issue management, leveraging a strong network of journalist relationships.
* Produce compelling content across formats—press releases, blog posts, videos, social media, and executive speeches—that brings Verisure’s priorities to life.
* Lead and manage reputational issues and crisis communications in coordination with local markets.
* Monitor and manage corporate reputation using a range of KPIs.
* Effectively manage the communications budget to maximize return on investment.
* Stay informed on industry trends, developments, and news, acting as our antenna for local market insights.
* Develop a comprehensive communications dashboard in collaboration with local leads to drive transparency, identify trends, and optimize impact.
* Build a strong and engaged communications community, ensuring the right capabilities and talent are in place. Promote best-in-class practices and knowledge-sharing across the cluster so great ideas scale quickly and effectively.
* Lead and co-create horizontal networks with markets to enable rapid learning and execution.







**Engaging and impactful internal and external Communication Execution**



* Write, review, and edit a wide range of content tailored to different audiences—including strategic plans, presentations, messaging frameworks, talking points, Q&As, website copy, video scripts, external statements, and press releases.
* Serve as a company spokesperson, representing Verisure in the media. Ensure the brand leads public discourse and shapes perception around security for homes and small businesses.
* Oversee the company’s digital presence, including corporate website content and social media channels.







**Lead, develop and lift ESG while building relationships and reputation strategy**



* Lead and elevate ESG practices across the Nordics, coordinating efforts across countries to scale impact and crafting compelling narratives that highlight ongoing initiatives.
* Build and manage the company’s reputation by communicating our values, mission, and achievements to key external stakeholders—including media, partners, industry groups, and civil society organizations.
* Identify and cultivate strategic relationships that enhance Verisure’s external reputation and showcase the positive impact we make in society.
* In close collaboration with Group Legal and local teams, develop a Public Affairs strategy that supports our commercial goals and mitigates potential risks. Provide communications support to Legal in interactions with regulators.
* Partner with the marketing team to ensure consistent brand messaging across all communication channels and contribute to strategies that strengthen brand reputation.







**Candidate profile** 






 Experience and Qualifications
 





**We are looking for a top performer - proactive, solution-oriented, and driven to deliver meaningful impact. Someone who sees Verisure not just as a job, but as a long-term career destination. A high-calibre, high-energy individual with a strong communications background, robust project management skills, and potential for development.** 
 You bring a strategic mindset, hands-on execution capability, and a proactive business orientation. Adaptable, curious, and growth-driven, you’re ready to shape how we tell our story and strengthen our market presence. Someone we can truly invest in and grow into one of Verisure’s next-generation leaders.
 






* **Minimum of 15 years of experience in corporate and external communications roles, within global, fast-paced B2C environments, including sectors such as retail, telco, FMCG, and subscription-based services.**
* **Substantial experience in international, multicultural organizations, with hands-on leadership of remote and cross-functional teams across diverse markets.**
* Bachelor’s degree or higher, preferably in communications, public relations, marketing, business administration, or a related field.
* Strong experience managing media relations, acting as company spokesperson, and leading issues and crisis communications.
* Proven ability to develop and execute impactful brand and communications strategies aligned with broader commercial and reputational goals. Demonstrated excellence in writing, messaging, and interpersonal communication, with meticulous attention to detail and a track record of delivering high-quality work.
* Proven project management skills, successfully leading complex, cross-functional projects involving multiple departments to drive strategic alignment and timely execution. Experienced in managing multiple, simultaneous initiatives in fast-paced environments, ensuring quality, accuracy, and adherence to deadlines.
* Skilled in navigating competing priorities, balancing customer-centric communication needs with business demands to deliver measurable outcomes.
* Known for building strong, trust-based relationships with senior stakeholders, influencing through business acumen and clear, compelling communication.
* Growth-minded and curious, with a drive to challenge the status quo and elevate communication practices across channels and markets.
* Native Swedish speaker with fluency in English (written and spoken) is essential. Proficiency in other Nordic languages is a strong asset.











 Competencies
 
* **Problem Solving and Analytics** 
 – strong at structuring complex problems through quantitatively sound analysis, demonstrating exceptional business and commercial judgment. Ability to synthesize information into actionable conclusions enabling efficient decision making.
* **Agility and Flexibility** 
 - thrives in dynamic environments, adapting swiftly to new information and changing circumstances, and with a solid ability to navigate and operate successfully amidst complexity.
* **Effectiveness and Impact** 
 - self-motivated, proactive in self-development and demonstrates a hands-on approach to deliver by rolling up their sleeves and deep dive into the details
* **Entrepreneurial** 
 - forward thinker who can challenge the status quo while maintaining a strong customer focus. Willing to take a "hands on" approach, while keeping strategic objectives in mind.
* **Project Management** 
  - excellent project manager who can step in an structure problems, launches and proactively address and follow through on issues to ensure outstanding execution
* **Communication** 
 - active listener, with high emotional intelligence and decision-making ability with discernment, who communicates clearly and effectively, projecting credibility, capable of influencing stakeholders across various levels. Also good at managing confidentiality.







 Strong fit with our Company DNA
 

**Passionate in Everything We Do:** 
 Our people bring a contagious energy and a sense of urgency that is unmistakable. We create a vision and inspire others around that vision with full engagement and focus. We are all-in, and we love what we do.
 



**Committed to Making a Difference:** 
 We are courageous, we deliver what we promise through hard work and resilience. We make a difference, through operating with discipline and doing what is needed. We are hands-on, and we aren’t afraid to get into the detail. We deliver results and we execute with excellence.
 



**Always Innovating:** 
 Our people make the impossible possible; it’s a continuous state of mind. We are purpose-driven, curious and we challenge the status quo. We believe good ideas travel, we share and reapply. We take smart risks, and we are not afraid to fail. We believe innovation can be big or small. 
 



**Winning as a Team:** 
 We are determined to become number 1, and to do that we need to listen to one another, collaborate and work together. We play our part, fueled by a winning attitude and a fighting spirit. We celebrate our successes. We play to our strengths and our diversity to deliver even better outcomes, while developing and supporting one another. We believe that together we go further, and that nothing is impossible.
 



**With Trust & Responsibility:** 
 Our people take responsibility for the people we protect. We are accountable and reliable. We role model operating with integrity. We trust and empower one another to do the right thing, always. We deliver on our promise through world-class expertise and meticulous know-how. And we do this with humility while being honoured to play such an important role in society.
 







 Strong fit with Verisure RISE Leadership Model
 





**R** 
**ole Model Responsible Owner:** 
 Acting as a long-term owner, always putting the customer first, thinking and acting big and being accountable and responsible.
 



**I** 
**nspire Outstanding Performance:** 
 Motivating others for high performance, prioritising and making decisions with an analytical approach and executing with excellence.
 



**S** 
**trengthen and grow a high-performance, diverse organisation:** 
 Building high-performance and diverse teams, enhancing a learning culture by setting continuously higher standards.
 



**E** 
**mpower and lead with courage, integrity, and purpose:** 
 Inspiring our people, honouring our mission and purpose by leading with confidence, positive energy and genuine empathy and humility.
 







 Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure
 





 At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status.

title: DevOps Engineer, Infrastructure (Full-time; m/f/d)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we secure the new society that emerges in the ever-expanding world of digital transformation. By challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing technology for high-demand global clients. Nexus’ Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms are changing how we perceive trusted identities. Do you want to be a part of our journey?*
 Henrik Hjelm, our Director Infrastructure & Tooling and his team, are looking to strengthen the team with a talented DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) to join our Stockholm office.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Cutting-Edge Technologies: Work with advanced tools like Ansible, Terraform, OpenStack/OpenShift, Azure CI/CD, and Datadog, shaping the future of digital identity solutions.
* Global Impact: Contribute to innovative projects that secure and empower digital identities for organizations and individuals worldwide.
* Collaborative Culture: Be part of a dynamic team that values knowledge-sharing, continuous learning, and collaboration, supported by modern tools like Jira and ServiceNow.
* Professional Growth: Thrive in a tech-driven environment with opportunities to expand your expertise in cloud platforms, automation, and secure infrastructure.


 Want to know more? Check out our value proposition: To work with us!
   

  

  

  

**What You’ll Do At Nexus**
 As a DevOps Engineer (m/f/d), you will play a pivotal role in building secure, scalable, and automated solutions that empower digital identities worldwide. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

* Ensure the health and performance of our SaaS Service platform, maintaining its stability, scalability, and availability.
* Automate our platform using Terraform and Ansible, driving efficiency and innovation.
* Manage compliance with industry standards such as ISO27001, TISAX, and eIDAS, ensuring our operations meet the highest security and regulatory requirements.
* Be a key player in our on-call rotation, providing critical support and maintaining service continuity.


**Some of our Tech Stack:** 
 Openstack, Linux, Terraform, Ansible, Containerization, AWS and Azure.
   

  

**Some of our Tools:** 
 Terraform, Ansible (AWX), Datadog, Azure DevOps Pipelines.
   

  

**About You**
* You thrive on solving complex problems and finding innovative solutions.
* You enjoy taking the initiative, driving projects forward, and embracing responsibility.
* Your curiosity fuels your creativity, and you love exploring new approaches and ideas.


**Qualifications**
* Several years of hands-on experience with similar systems.
* Minimum Swedish Gymnasium level education, with higher education preferred.
* Familiarity with our current tech stack and previous work experience within these technologies.
* Working proficiency in English is essential; skills in Swedish speaking and writing are a plus.
* Willingness to participate in our on-call routine.


**Not sure you meet 100% of the qualifications?**
 At Nexus, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.
   

  

**Background check**
 Transparency, security, and trust are the core of our company; therefore, the final candidate will be subjected to a background check before training.
   

  

 Nexus is an equal-opportunity employer. We truly believe in being ONE Nexus. You are welcomed at Nexus for who you are, no matter where you come from or what you look like. Our technology is for everyone, and so is our workplace. So, bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background to thrive, collaborate, and be forward-thinking! It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep innovating the way we secure the world.
   

  

**Joining Nexus** 
 means becoming a part of IN Groupe, an international group of around 2000 employees on five continents.
   

  

 IN Groupe and Nexus are here to protect the identities of people and things making life both safer and simpler.
   

  

 The group meets the needs of states, businesses, and hundreds of millions of users in Europe and throughout the world.
   

  

 We provide the best of technology and innovation, in a sustainable manner, now and for future generations.
   

  

 At Nexus we believe transparency is a prerequisite for trust and therefore all our
 **products and services are documented online.**

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**About Northbridge** 




 Our vision is simple – Northbridge should be the obvious choice for highly skilled tech professionals. By offering freedom, responsibility, and competence, we aim to create a consultancy that is a real alternative to traditional employment. Here, you have the power over your own future and development.
 



  





 At Northbridge, we have an experienced and fearless group of developers, architects, and designers who regularly take on leading roles when collaborating with our clients. Our focus is on building modern and scalable systems through carefully considered choices of programming languages, tools, and cloud-based services.
 



  





**What we offer** 




**Freedom:** 
 Take control of your time and work on your terms – you decide your own salary model, vacation, and how many trips you want to make each year. Freedom, for real. At Northbridge, we believe it works best when our colleagues choose the assignments they want. Here, you decide what type of projects you want to be part of. We also believe in innovation, which is why we run something called
 *North Labs* 
 , where you also have the opportunity to work on your own projects.
 



**Responsibility:** 
 We believe in giving you responsibility for your own work and your development. Want to attend Web Summit next year with some colleagues? We’ll make it happen!
 



**Competence:** 
 Mentorship and Coaching – we support your growth through internal mentors, knowledge-sharing lectures, events, and other internal activities. An online community, wiki, and knowledge database for sharing knowledge.
 



  





  





**What we are looking for** 




 In the role of Senior Developer with us, there is an exciting opportunity to constantly develop and grow in your professional role. We are looking for someone who has the ability to transform innovative ideas into concrete functions, while maintaining an impressive balance between quality and delivery (Focus on quality).
 



  





 We will encourage you to break new ground and explore new technologies, giving you the opportunity to expand your technical skills. Therefore, we see that you as a person like to test new ways of solving problems and dare to guide the customers to do so as well.
 



  





 We think you have a good mix of previous lead or architecture roles and at the same time wanting to still be hands-on with the code. You feel comfortable taking ownership and can communicate clearly with the customer.
 



  





**Buzzwords you might have encountered** 
 :
 *C# .NET, Java, Kotlin, JavaScript, React, Vue,
 
 Node.js
 
 , Flutter, AWS, GCP, Azure, Microservices, Cleancode, DevOps, IaC, DevSecOps, Python, AI.* 




  





 For this job you need to be based in Stockholm and hold a Swedish work permit.

title: senior Test Automation Engineer
description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning
   

  

 Vi söker en
 **senior Test Automation Engineer** 
 med särskild kompetens inom
 **Python** 
 . Rollen kräver en person som är kommunikativ, har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs i ett internationellt teamarbete.
   

  

 Uppdraget är kopplat till utvecklingen av nästa generations pumplösningar, där fokus ligger på:
   

  

* Intelligenta, mjukvarustyrda pumpar
* Energieffektivisering
* Självrengörande funktioner


**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Nätverks- och Infrastrukturspecialist till snabbväxande IT-bolag
description:
Brinner du för nätverk och kommunikation och tycker om att följa den senaste tekniken? Vågar du utmana kunder med ny teknik och nya tekniska lösningar? I takt med att vår kund växer, söker de nu förstärkning till deras konsultteam inom Infrastruktur och Nätverk. Vi söker dig som är nätverkstekniker och har arbetat med infrastruktur och vill bli kundens stjärna inom området.
 



  





 Område: Solna
 



 Start: Omgående, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
 



  





 Tjänsten inleds som konsultuppdrag med ambitionen att gå över till kund.
 



  





 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




*I rollen som nätverks- och infrastrukturspecialist kommer du att arbeta med:* 




 • Routing, switching, brandväggar och trådlösa nätverk
 



 • Säkerställa en stabil och säker IT-infrastruktur
 



 • Konfigurera och implementera lösningar
 



 • Agera rådgivare inom både nätverk och infrastruktur
 



 • Delta i strategisk planering och optimering
 



 • Dokumentera och rapportera tekniska lösningar
 



  





*Utöver nätverkslösningar kommer du även att:* 




 • Arbeta med server- och datacenterinfrastruktur, inklusive virtualisering
 



 • Delta i implementering och drift av system ute hos kunder
 



  





 Du blir en del av ett team på sju personer som arbetar tätt tillsammans för att leverera robusta och effektiva IT-lösningar.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




 För att trivas i rollen tycker du om och drivs av att ge bra service och arbeta hårt mot både individuella och gemensamma mål. Du är samarbetsvillig, tycker om att arbeta i team samt är flexibel i ditt förhållningssätt. Stundtals är tempot mycket högt och kan variera från dag till dag, därför är det viktigt att du är bra på att hantera tempoväxlingar och gillar approachen att man hugger i när och var det behövs.
 



  





 Du har ett stort tekniskt intresse, är självgående och stresstålig. I ditt arbete kommer du att ta stort eget ansvar och kommer att arbeta självständigt och i grupp. Du tillför ny energi och är en god lagspelare.
 



  





*För att passa för rollen behöver du ha flera kompetenser inom:* 




 • 8–10 års erfarenhet inom IT, med fokus på nätverk och infrastruktur
 



 • Cisco produkter (ISE, Meraki, WLC, Nexus)
 



 • Fortinet-brandväggar
 



 • Sophos säkerhetslösningar
 



 • Erfarenhet av server- och datacenterinfrastruktur, inklusive virtualisering (VMware, Hyper-V, KVM).
 



 • Kunskaper inom molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
 



  





 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Mobile App Platform Engineer - React Native
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of banks, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?* 




  





**In brief** 




  





 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery we are building the next generation investment platform.
 



  





**This is part of the role** 




  





 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value to our customers with continuous releases several times a week.
 



  





**This is you** 




  





 To thrive in this role, we believe that you love to contribute to a state-of-the-art developer experience and to work on improving and modernizing our mobile technology stack. You can easily connect with people, have a solution-oriented mindset and are happy to help and support others.
 



  





**As a Mobile App Platform Engineer, You** 




  




* Are confident in mobile development. Our tech stack includes JavaScript/TypeScript, React Native, Redux, RTK Query, Testing library, MSW, React Navigation, GitHub actions and Expo
* Have a birds eye perspective when setting the architecture for the future
* Are motivated when faced with complex technical problems
* Are eager to automate things



  





**A Bonus Is If You** 




  




* Are knowledgeable in Java and Terraform
* Are interested or have experience with the rest of the tech stack, which includes GCP, Nginx, Docker, Kubernetes and ArgoCD



  





**Nordnetters** 




  




* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improving to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to our goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* Experienced team which build own products and support other teams and products
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation
* Flexible work setup (from office or hybrid)



  





 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. We are embracing the agile way of working.
 



  





 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
 



  





 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. Visit us on:
 **www.nordnetab.com** 




  





**Questions & applications** 




  





 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered. We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Integration leader
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **5+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

 Rollbeskrivning:
   

  

**Assignment**
 We are seeking an Integration Leader for our EE Integration team (VCT Integration & Test). This role focuses on planning and coordinating integration activities across embedded systems and software domains, ensuring alignment with release milestones and system maturity targets. The consultant will be responsible for interfacing with multiple teams, visualizing functionality scope, and driving master test planning for major introductions. Strong coordination, planning, and stakeholder management skills are essential, along with a proactive mindset and a structured approach to complex integration challenges. The initial focus of this assignment will be to support the first steps toward the TRATON Modular Electrical Platform, including early integration planning, test coordination, and cross-functional alignment.
   

  

**Where will the assignment be performed (Onsite, Hybrid, offsite)**
 Hybrid
   

  

**Education**
 Bachelor's Degree in engineering, business administration, computer science or
   

  

 information technology
   

  

**Language**
 English
   

  

**Meriting**
 Knowledge about Scania´s electrical system and/or embedded systems in vehicles. Other Specifications
   

  

**Initial Focus**
 The initial focus of this assignment will be to support the first steps toward the TRATON Modular ElectricalPlatform, including early integration planning, test coordination, and cross-functional alignment. The consultant will play a key role in laying the foundation for scalable and modular integration practices aligned with TRATON’s strategic direction.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain integration plans for major initiatives, including maturity level tracking and milestone alignment.
* Coordinate and follow up on test results and status updates for Embedded Milestones.
* Interface with system architects, technical system owners, function owners, and test teams to ensure integration readiness.
* Visualize functionality scope and dependencies across teams and systems.
* Create and manage master test plans for system introductions and integration checkpoints.
* Facilitate integration meetings and checkpoints to ensure timely execution and issue resolution.
* Support continuous improvement of integration processes and workflows.
* Collaborate with Release Coordinators, RTEs, and STEs to align integration activities with release trains.
* Track and communicate integration progress, risks, and mitigation plans.


 Key Skills & Competencies
   

  

* Strong planning and coordination skills, with experience in integration management.
* Proficiency in Jira.
* Effective communication and stakeholder engagement across technical and non-technical teams.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and drive structured follow-up in a dynamic environment.
* Experience with embedded systems and software integration processes.
* Familiarity with SAFe and agile principles is meriting.
* Previous experience with Scania and its integration processes is advantageous.


**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: People Partner - fixed-term contract
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**About Kambi**
*Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.*
*Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.*
 We are now looking for a People Partner to join our People Team on a fixed-term contract, covering parental leave from September 1st, 2025, to the earliest August 31st, 2026, with the possibility to extend.
   

  

 As a People Partner You’ll act as a strategic advisor and coach to our leaders, helping to shape a highly performing, engaged, and inclusive workplace. This role is ideal for someone passionate about people’s development, organizational effectiveness, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring**
* Experience in an HR generalist or HRBP role.
* Strong knowledge of People principles, practices, and Swedish employment laws.
* Proven ability to build strong relationships and influence at all levels of the organization.
* Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and decision-making skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Fluent English is required.


**What You'll Do**
* Strategic People Advisory Serve as a trusted advisor to managers at all levels, offering guidance across all areas of people management, including performance, compensation, team development, onboarding, and feedback.
* Performance & Reward Cycles Support managers through performance management processes, including salary reviews and promotion cycles, ensuring fairness and alignment with business goals.
* Engagement & Culture Coach managers on interpreting and acting on employee engagement data to foster a positive and productive team environment.
* Policy & Compliance Ensure compliance with local regulations and alignment with best practices.
* Collaboration & Innovation Work closely with colleagues in the People team to continuously enhance our tools, frameworks, and ways of working.


**Is Kambi a place for you?**
 We highly value soft skills such as collaboration, communication, and problem-solving abilities. Our teams have a high level of autonomy in decisions around solutions and ways of working. You will thrive in this role if you are curious, enjoy technical discussions with your team and willing to collaborate to find the most suitable solution.
   

  

 We offer friendly, welcoming, and inclusive working culture in an international work environment. We value learning and development, both on an individual level and as a whole organization. It is important for us that we grow together. We like to have fun with our colleagues, but we also understand that each employee needs their flexibility to thrive.
   

  

 And one last thing...
   

  

 We would be happy if you tick off all our boxes, yet we also believe it is just as important we tick off all of yours. And if you think you have most of what we are looking for, but not every single thing, go ahead and hit apply. We would still love to hear from you! We want a balance between office work and working from home. We believe we will all gain from the best of both worlds, so the way of working in Kambi is hybrid – we want to have a chance to work with you in our Stockholm office a minimum of 2 days in a week.
   

  

 #wearekambi
   

  

***Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace***
*If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.*
***Creating an inclusive environment***
*We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.*
*#wearekambi*

title: OSS_BSS Senior Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Business Area Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) is created to capitalize on the opportunity of the convergence of cloud and services. As our customers deploy 5G and programable networks, our aim is to accelerate the optimization and automation of increasingly complex networks, by redefining to cloud and AI native software and services.
   

  

 Solution Area Business & Operations Support Systems (SA BOS) is built to provide a leading portfolio with an outstanding customer experience by aligning architecture, products, services, roadmaps, and commercial structure.
   

  

 SA BOS Technology Evolution is built to develop and maintain the product and solution direction architecture, secure alignment with respect to main standardization bodies and
   

  

 drive the overall Technology Strategy and Technology Leadership within the Solution Area BOS portfolio.
   

  

 We are looking for a person that really likes to work with other people in technology and architecture with the aim to guide our evolution in the best possible direction for medium- and long-term business success. As the cross-portfolio technology and architecture responsible unit in solution area BSS and OSS, we are scouting new technologies, and business needs to understand the best value and adoption in our product and services portfolio.
   

  

 You will join our architecture authority unit within the Technology Evolution team in BCSS SA BOS(OSS/BSS) consisting of approximately 40 persons in two units. We are strategically co-located with our key centers (head quarter, R&D and Services) in Kista, Karlskrona, Athlone, Budapest, São Paulo, Toronto, Ottawa, Chennai and Gurgaon.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 To guide and direct our product/solution and services portfolio to a competitive technology and architecture evolution.
   

  

* understanding technology trends and standards and connect them with the evolution/requirements of our products and solutions
* Understand our products and domains and their business
* Work to distinguishing the Ericsson portfolio from the competitors


 Develop and anchor the BOS portfolio product and services portfolio evolution from a technology and architecture perspective
   

  

* Drive and/or participate in technology and architecture studies
* Drive or participate in proof of concepts
* Understand and contribute to relevant global standards (TMF, 3GPP, CAMARA, GSMA)
* Support cross Solution Area standardization and integration initiatives and global programs impacting SA BOS.
* Cooperation and collaboration with Architecture and Strategy teams within and outside SA BOS
* Collaborate with Portfolio to prioritize the road map in regard to technology and architecture


**The skills you bring:**
* BSc in Engineering/Computer Science or similar, MBA as plus.
* Technology and business savvy (technology and trends are shifting rapidly and you need to enjoy taking on new areas and connect to value)
* Extensive R&D experience, (process and LCM to design once, sell many?)
* Strong technical domain knowledge in NW Service Orchestration and Assurance, and/or radio network management, and/or core NW management, and/or business support (core Commerce, Charging and Billing)


**Other Qualifications:**
* Proven leader for technical teams and customer engagements
* Positive attitude
* drives change through continuous improvements
* Proven ability to communicate and influence (skilled in creating, documenting, and presenting technology and value argumentation)
* Human skills and safety to understand and respectfully have persons from all hierarchies in your personal network
* An established personal NW within R&D of one or several of the requested technical domains in Ericsson
* An established personal NW within product management and/or sales of one or several of the requested technical domains in Ericsson
* An established personal NW in customer units/regions for one or several of the requested technical domains in Ericsson
* A combined experience of SW development, Architecture, product management and leadership
* Hands-on experience from competition


 Location: Sweden (Kista, Karlskrona), Athlone, Budapest, São Paulo, Toronto, Ottawa, Chennai and Gurgaon.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 768221

title: Kundtjänstmedarbetare till samhällsviktiga kommunikationstjänster
description:
**Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap**
 MSB arbetar för ett säkrare samhälle i en föränderlig värld med fokus på utveckling av det civila försvaret. Vi stärker Sveriges förmåga att fungera i kris och till och med krig. Det betyder att alla våra medarbetare bidrar till beredskap och motståndskraft. Från norr till söder sprider vi kunskap och agerar för att skydda liv och hälsa, samhällets funktionalitet och grundläggande värden som demokrati, rättssäkerhet och mänskliga rättigheter. Den 1 januari byter vi namn till Myndigheten för civilt försvar .
   

  

 Vill du göra skillnad och tillsammans med oss arbeta för ett säkrare samhälle? Då kanske du är vår nästa kollega!
   

  

 Som kundtjänstmedarbetare hos oss blir du en central punkt i arbetet med att stödja användarorganisationer genom att erbjuda snabb och kompetent teknisk support. Med en kombination av teknisk problemlösning och administrativa uppgifter får du möjlighet att bidra direkt till samhällsviktiga funktioner samtidigt som du gör en verklig skillnad för våra användare – varje dag i våra tjänster Rakel, WIS och SGSI.
 **Ditt ansvar och dina arbetsuppgifter**
 Som kundtjänstmedarbetare inom vår tekniska kundtjänst blir du en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att samhällsviktiga kommunikationstjänster fungerar optimalt. I rollen som första linjens support hanterar du både administrativa och tekniska supportärenden. Du ansvarar för att ta emot och hantera beställningar kopplade till abonnemang och deras struktur i nätet, samtidigt som du utför felsökning, felanalys och åtgärder för att lösa tekniska problem hos våra användare.
   

  

 Som en viktig länk mellan användarorganisationer och vår verksamhet kommunicerar du med utsedda kontaktpersoner och beställare inom organisationerna för att säkerställa att åtgärder genomförs korrekt och effektivt. Du hanterar även beställningar och konfigurationsändringar samt bidrar aktivt till att skapa och förbättra rutiner, instruktioner och dokumentation i vår kunskapsdatabas. Tillsammans med övriga medarbetare ser du till att information och arbetsprocesser hålls uppdaterade och relevanta.
   

  

 Denna roll erbjuder en kombination av kundkontakt, teknisk problemlösning och administrativa arbetsuppgifter där du får möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad för samhällets kritiska kommunikationstjänster.
   

  

**Dina kunskaper och kompetenser**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst gymnasial examen.
* Flerårig erfarenhet av kundservice och/eller teknisk support.
* God dator- och systemvana.
* God förmåga att obehindrat tala och skriva på svenska och engelska.


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Utbildning inom IT/telekommunikation.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Tactilon.
* Erfarenhet inomkundservice eller teknisk support hos en mobiloperatör.
* Erfarenhet från arbete med TETRA-system, till exempel Rakel.


 Som alla medarbetare och ledare hos oss förväntas du kunna arbeta uppdragsorienterat, utvecklingsinriktat, dialoginriktat, ha god självkännedom och bidra genom att vara ett föredöme.
   

  

 Du är lugn, uppmärksam och tillmötesgående i ditt bemötande, med en stark vilja att hjälpa och leverera lösningar. Du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar ditt arbete effektivt och ser till att tidsramar hålls. Noggrannhet och kvalitet är viktigt för dig, och du arbetar målmedvetet för att alltid nå uppsatta mål och standarder.
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Vi erbjuder dig en anställning tillsvidare på heltid som inleds med en provanställning. Din placeringsort kommer att vara Stockholm och resor i anställningen förekommer.
   

  

 Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för anställning på MSB då den innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. För anställning krävs godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövningen med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Enheten för kundsupport och användarstöd är under uppbyggnad och kommer att ingå i driftsorganisationen. Dess främsta uppgift är att fungera som kontaktpunkt mot användarorganisationerna för verksamhetens tjänster. Enheten ansvarar för att tillhandahålla kundsupport i första linjen och ge stöd i användningen av verksamhetens samhällsviktiga kommunikationstjänster. Utöver detta ansvarar enheten även för verksamhetens kundadministration.
